intro: Trautvetteria palmata var. minor, commonly known as the lesser palmate trautvetteria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps. The species is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the ecological diversity of these environments.
